channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @DainyBernstein Under Sartmar theology, do the מחללי שבת Jews who contributed to the creation of the vaccines that saved millions of lives go to heaven or hell?
item.source:markdown: @DainyBernstein Under Sartmar theology, do the מחללי שבת Jews who contributed to the creation of the vaccines that saved millions of lives go to heaven or hell?

item.description:
Rightly or wrongly, “Forever Autumn” is on my Elul playlist. https://t.co/cocRWokcZp

Which has some nice additions since last year. https://t.co/7q9LY6Be3s

Speaking of which: Spotify thinks I should add these songs. Should I? Discuss! https://t.co/1Nlf0hnOfB
item.source:markdown:
Rightly or wrongly, “Forever Autumn” is on my Elul playlist. https://t.co/cocRWokcZp
Which has some nice additions since last year. https://t.co/7q9LY6Be3s

item.description:
@Dem_Bitz I’m an outsider, and there should be insiders who can answer better, but my sense is they’re functionally synonyms. You can say Chabad chasidim or Lubavitch chasidim and though they mean slightly different things, I think they can be used interchangeably.

@Dem_Bitz My guess is you’re more likely to see Chabad used within the movement (since it’s their mission/belief statement) and less likely by other chasidim, who aren’t ready to cede the first three sefirot to the folk from Lubavitch.
item.source:markdown:
@Dem_Bitz I’m an outsider, and there should be insiders who can answer better, but my sense is they’re functionally synonyms. You can say Chabad chasidim or Lubavitch chasidim and though they mean slightly different things, I think they can be used interchangeably.
@Dem_Bitz My guess is you’re more likely to see Chabad used within the movement (since it’s their mission/belief statement) and less likely by other chasidim, who aren’t ready to cede the first three sefirot to the folk from Lubavitch.

item.description: @rmneiss Meme: Hazony poised between two red buttons, sweating the decision. One is labeled “opposed women’s sufferage.” The other: “Preached and practiced universal love and harmony.”
item.source:markdown: @rmneiss Meme: Hazony poised between two red buttons, sweating the decision. One is labeled “opposed women’s sufferage.” The other: “Preached and practiced universal love and harmony.”

item.description:
@AkivaMCohen Not sure how much thought to put into a dubiously-sourced graph, but the plateau grabs my attention. Could it reflect a growth in gay marriages as they were gradually legalized undercutting the preexisting decline?

@AkivaMCohen And then just a return to the mean?

@AkivaMCohen Also, really weird not to factor out population effects. How much of the delta is driven by fewer married couples losing a partner to death or divorce versus single people not marrying? Those are all pretty age dependent variables.

@AkivaMCohen And given that the graph charts individuals per thousand, I can see a small change in birth rates decades ago explaining all of this.
@gwensnyderPHL Maybe this is just publicity for a yet-to-be-announced mermaid/Middle Earth crossover?
item.source:markdown: @gwensnyderPHL Maybe this is just publicity for a yet-to-be-announced mermaid/Middle Earth crossover?

item.description: @EladNehorai Is the Catholic Church really free if it can’t burn people in the town square for the crime of reading Jewish books?
item.source:markdown: @EladNehorai Is the Catholic Church really free if it can’t burn people in the town square for the crime of reading Jewish books?

item.description:
@EladNehorai ״על תקרא חרות אלא חרות״

@EladNehorai Or in Orwell’s colloquial translation, “Freedom is Slavery.”
item.source:markdown:
@EladNehorai ״על תקרא חרות אלא חרות״
@EladNehorai Or in Orwell’s colloquial translation, “Freedom is Slavery.”

item.description: @EricJGreenberg1 Does Art still draw? He may be sufficiently reclusive and idiosyncratic that it might be worth it to offer him a ridiculously small @BenYehudaPress advance for him to take it on. But I don’t think he’s invested enough in chasidism one way or the other to go for it.
item.source:markdown: @EricJGreenberg1 Does Art still draw? He may be sufficiently reclusive and idiosyncratic that it might be worth it to offer him a ridiculously small @BenYehudaPress advance for him to take it on. But I don’t think he’s invested enough in chasidism one way or the other to go for it.

item.description:
@johnastoehr Either he’s changing the subject for DJT, or he’s trying to play in the Senate big leagues (and grab some mindshare from Mitch) and is simply incompetent.

@johnastoehr Or a combination: TFG is waging war against China Mitch, so Graham sees an opportunity.
item.source:markdown:
@johnastoehr Either he’s changing the subject for DJT, or he’s trying to play in the Senate big leagues (and grab some mindshare from Mitch) and is simply incompetent.
@johnastoehr Or a combination: TFG is waging war against China Mitch, so Graham sees an opportunity.

item.description: @HeerJeet I think a reasonable goal for generative AI is being able to ask for “An opera of The Demolished Man as written by Thomas Pynchon” and get back a satisfactory result.
item.source:markdown: @HeerJeet I think a reasonable goal for generative AI is being able to ask for “An opera of The Demolished Man as written by Thomas Pynchon” and get back a satisfactory result.

item.description: As Yeshiva University looks to Republican lawyers and judges to keep it free of the gay and the gay-supportive, a Republican candidate for governor goes after the Jewish day school where his opponent’s kids are enrolled. https://t.co/kPvPDZi5bV
